title: Knowledge Graph-Augmented Language Models for Knowledge-Grounded Dialogue Generation

sections.baselines and our models:
No Knowledge. The model only with the dialogue history.
All Knowledge. The model with entire facts within a k𝑘k-hop subgraph.
Gold Knowledge. The model with the exact gold knowledge if it exists.
Space Efficient Encoding. The model with all facts from the k𝑘k-hop subgraph. We use two variants from , namely series and parallel.
EARL. The latest RNN-based model, where the entities are conditioned in response generation .
DiffKG. PLM-based model with differentiable path traversal [ref]40.
Random/Sparse Retrieval. The model with selected facts via random sampling or sparse retrieval [ref]33.
Dense Retrieval. A variant of our framework where T5 encoder  is used for d𝑑d in  Equation 3 instead of GNNs similar to Bi- and Poly-encoder .
SURGE (unsupervised). Ours with retrieved context-relevant facts from k𝑘k-hop subgraph, where the retrieval is trained without any supervision.
SURGE (semi-supervised). Ours but the retriever is trained with ℒs​u​psubscriptℒ𝑠𝑢𝑝\mathcal{L}_{sup} if the gold exists.
SURGE (contrastive). Ours with ℒr​e​tsubscriptℒ𝑟𝑒𝑡\mathcal{L}_{ret}, ℒs​u​psubscriptℒ𝑠𝑢𝑝\mathcal{L}_{sup}, and ℒc​o​n​tsubscriptℒ𝑐𝑜𝑛𝑡\mathcal{L}_{cont} in Section 3.6.
